summary: This bill, the New Producer Economic Security Act, establishes a program within the Farm Service Agency to provide grants, cooperative agreements, or capital support to eligible entities. The program aims to increase access to land, capital, and markets for qualified beneficiaries, defined as farmers, ranchers, or forest owners, particularly those who are new to farming or are economically disadvantaged. Eligible projects include acquiring land, providing financial assistance, and offering technical support. The Secretary of Agriculture will establish a stakeholder committee to advise on fund distribution.
